title: Yasuo windwall
body:
Should consume all his flow

if you have 10% flow it lasts for 10% of the normal time etc

As much as I hate Yasuo (not saying he's unbalanced, just the most annoying champion in the game for my champ pool), this is a really terrible (yet popular) idea for him.  He'd need some massive buffs to make up for this, and it doesn't really remove his issues.  He'd still be resistant to regular harass in lane and he'd likely have access to an even larger and/or longer lasting windwall during teamfights.

I think the best change would be to make wind-wall on a shorter cooldown with a much shorter duration.  If he needs buffs to compensate, I'd put them mostly towards his base health at higher levels (I don't think this would affect his early quite so much).

Ok, i understand that Yasuo's windwall is very frustrating and annoying, but its by no means broken. Yes it can stop some very important moves, but it really comes down to counter play and skill which people seem to forget Yasuo takes. For instance as and ADC if a Yasuo comes up to you and he windwalls, you can simply run away, and it makes the Wall useless. If Yasuo were to Windwall and ult or other skillshot, a good amount of the time it was him predicting it and using it appropriately when he thinks it is the best. That also takes into account for the other player, they need to think about when a Yas may W and try to time your skill shot or what ever it may be around the idea that he has wall. There are so many other situations, but i feel that although it is very annoying by no means is it broken
I do think that the 3rd Q and Windwall should use a % if not flat scaling amounts of flow.
